techmeme.title: Instagram launches Rings, an awards program recognizing 25 top creators; the judging panel includes Spike Lee, designer Marc Jacobs, and Adam Mosseri (Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter)
Google DeepMind unveils CodeMender, an AI agent that autonomously detects, patches, and rewrites vulnerable code, leveraging Gemini Deep Think models (Duncan Riley/SiliconANGLE)
OpenAI executive Bill Peebles says Sora users can now stop AI-generated versions of themselves from appearing in certain contexts like videos involving politics (Robert Hart/The Verge)
Deloitte says it will partially refund payment for an AU$439K Australian government report that contained multiple errors and was partly produced by AI (Ellesheva Kissin/Financial Times)
Paris-based Filigran, which develops open-source threat intelligence tools, raised a $58M Series C led by French VC Eurazeo and reports 6K+ users (Daphné Leprince-Ringuet/Sifted)
